intro: Brombya platynema, commonly known as the narrow-leaf brombya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences of white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping.
